Real-World Evidence: What’s all the hype?

RWE
Observational Data
Author

Ryan Batten

Published

August 7, 2022

You may have seen real-world evidence (RWE) being used increasingly in research settings. It has tremendous potential to be useful to answer important research questions, however what is RWE? The principles are nothing new, however it is being increasingly common. RWE is generated from real-world data (RWD). RWD is defined by the FDA as data relating to patient health status and/or the delivery of health care routinely collected from a variety of sources (Administration and Drug December 2018). This data could be from electronic health records, medical claims and billing, electronic medical records, data from product registries, wearable devices, mobile devices and other sources. Sounds pretty good right? Well the quality of the evidence is only as a good as the quality of the study conducted.

Hierarchy of Research

Historically, the hierarchy of research has been that systematic reviews with a meta-analysis are at the top of the evidence pyramid, followed by randomized controlled trials (RCTs), cohort studies, case-control studies and anecdotal research.

RCTs are near the top of this pyramid for good reason. A well-conducted RCT can provide insight into efficacy of a treatment in a controlled environment so that no data is missing. There are however, drawbacks/potential limitations including: RCTs can be expensive to conduct, can require a long duration of follow-up, are not feasible to conduct ethically and limited generalizability. Luckily, observational study designs can help fill in the gaps in these areas.

Observational Studies

When people discuss about the hierarchy of study design, such as in Figure 1, the quality of the study is not mentioned. For example, is a poorly conducted RCT better than a rigorously conducted case-control study using observational data? That is up for debate however, observational studies can be used to supplement findings from RCTs or where RCTs are infeasible.

Examples of RWE

Administration, U. S. Food, and Drug. December 2018. “Framework for FDA’s Real-World Evidence Program.” Report.
